Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a variety of plants found in a chosen land habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, bushes).
The student can draw and label a variety of animals found in a chosen land habitat (e.g., squirrels, lizards, ants).
The student can draw and label a variety of plants found in a chosen water habitat (e.g., aquatic plants, algae).
The student can draw and label a variety of animals found in a chosen water habitat (e.g., fish, clams).
The student can clearly show and compare different living things in at least two different habitats (land vs. water).
The student can illustrate patterns of diversity by showing different kinds of living things in each habitat.
